qas.question: Reports from who made the change evident?
Where did Sir Henry Norman travel in 1894
What book did Sir Henry Norman write after traveling to the Far East?

answers.text: The Peoples and Politics of the Far East

qas.question: What year did Sir Henry Norman's book come out?

context: The change is evident in the reports of <a0_0>influential British travellers<a0_0/> to the Balkans. In 1894, Sir Henry Norman, 1st Baronet, a journalist, travelled to <a1_0>the Far East<a1_0/>, afterwards writing a book called <a2_0>The Peoples and Politics of the Far East<a2_0/>, which came out in <a3_0>1895<a3_0/>. By "Far East" he meant Siberia, China, Japan, Korea, Siam and Malaya. As the book was a big success, he was off to the Balkan states with his wife in 1896 to develop detail for a sequel, The People and Politics of the Near East, which Scribners planned to publish in 1897. Mrs. Norman, a writer herself, wrote glowing letters of the home and person of Mme. Zakki, "the wife of a Turkish cabinet minister," who, she said, was a cultivated woman living in a country home full of books. As for the natives of the Balkans, they were "a semi-civilized people."
